revised_title: The Pharmacology of Indian Cobra Venom and its Effects on Blood Pressure and Respiration
tldr: This study investigates the effects of Indian Cobra venom on blood pressure and respiration in animals. The author found that the venom primarily affects the nervous system, causing paralysis of the respiratory centers and heart muscles. The research also highlights the importance of standardizing venom doses and considering the dosage received by a snake-bitten person for accurate conclusions.
